etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Royal Geographical Society of London. Probably from a Sudanese Arabic variant (the precise form of which is uncertain) of Yemenite Arabic ʿangareb, ʿangarēb, ʿangarāb, of unknown origin

definitions: In Sudan, Egypt, and some other East African countries: a light movable bedstead consisting of a wooden framework with a base of woven rope, animal hide, etc., also used as a sofa.
